request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Health Care Information

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must download a generic third-party release authorization form, print and hand-fill it, then fax it to the hospital.

red_flags: "All spaces on this form MUST be completed for this release to be valid" — blanket mandate exceeds HIPAA authorization requirements and creates a rejection mechanism
Witness signature line combined with all-fields-mandatory language effectively requires a witness, which HIPAA does not mandate
Form URL dates to 2014, suggesting no updates in over a decade
bright_spots: 18-category record-type checklist provides granular control over what information is released
Sensitive information consent sections correctly reference 42 CFR Part 2 redisclosure restrictions
Brief patient rights statement acknowledges right to review records and revoke authorization

findability.rationale: Level 2: Generic web searches failed; only a site-scoped search located the form, requiring persistence and knowledge of the hospital's domain.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — the PDF has zero fillable fields and is designed entirely for print-and-handwrite completion, though fax submission is available via the number on the form header.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate two-page length and logical sequence, but the confusing opt-out record selection, lack of visual hierarchy or section headers, and alarming legalese about adverse consequences create notable clarity problems.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is not addressed — the form is structured exclusively for third-party release with no dedicated patient access pathway, no 'personal use' reason option, and no guidance for patients requesting their own records.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: The all-fields-mandatory mandate and witness signature requirement go beyond HIPAA requirements for patient access; however, the form includes appropriate revocation provisions and sensitive information consent sections.

overall.summary: Millinocket Regional Hospital provides only a generic, non-fillable third-party release form that is hard to find and poorly suited for patient self-access, with unnecessary barriers including a witness requirement and blanket field-completion mandate.
